meta.name: description
meta.content: Welcome to the Exeter Unified School District (EUSD) Website! Exeter Unified School District (EUSD) serves students in grades K-12. EUSD is home to approximately 3,000 students from the town of Exeter and the rural areas that immediately surround the district to the northeast and the southwest. Founded more than one hundred years ago, the district is proud of their ongoing commitment to excellence.

article.aria-label: EUSD Superintendent's Open Letter to Parents

h3.a: EUSD Superintendent's Open Letter to Parents

div.div: Update- 4/9/20: Please review the online resources below and also the sample learning schedule for families. This is optional and is suggestion only. We know that many students are experiencing anxiety due to this situation and it is important that we remind our children and family members that we will get through this. Most people, especially children, find comfort in routine.

article.aria-label: Exeter Unified School District's School Closure

h3.a: Exeter Unified School District's School Closure

div.div: On Saturday, March 14, 2020, Exeter Unified held an Emergency Board Meeting regarding COVID-19. After careful consideration and out of an abundance of caution, our school board has moved to close Exeter Unified schools effective Wednesday, March 18, 2020.

article.aria-label: UPDATED: Exeter Unified Drive Thru Breakfast and Lunch

h3.a: UPDATED: Exeter Unified Drive Thru Breakfast and Lunch

div.div: Exeter Unified will be providing Drive Thru Breakfast & Lunch during the duration of school closures. These are offered to ALL students up to the age of 18, regardless of free or reduced meal status.

img.alt: meal distribution schedule for EUSD 4-20-20- english

div.p: Follow us on our social networks and stay up to date with our latest activities. We encourage you to participate in our school community.

li.a: Spotlight on Exeter Unified School District

div.p: The Exeter Unified School District (EUSD) is committed to ensuring equal, fair, and meaningful access to employment and education services. EUSD does not discriminate in any employment practice, education program, or educational activity on the basis and/or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics of age, ancestry, color, ethnic group identification, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, pregnancy and related conditions, race, religion, retaliation, sex (including sexual harassment), sexual orientation, Military Veterans status, homelessness, foster status, or any other basis prohibited by California state and federal nondiscrimination laws consistent with Education Code 200 and 220, Government Code 11135, and Title IX.

If you believe you have been subjected to discrimination, harassment, intimidation, or bullying, you should contact your school site principal and/or the District Office and Title IX Officer. A copy of EUSD's Uniform Complaint policy and Nondiscrimination policy are available here and upon request.
